website_summaries.verdict: Choose them if you want a crunchy (instead of soft) grain-free treat for your dog; otherwise choose the Triumph treats instead.
pros: Boasts a 100-percent grain-free recipe with only natural, wholesome ingredients – contains real meats and vegetable
They are baked and contain no chicken products
cons: They are pricey, and somewhat thin

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT USE!!!!  LAWSUIT for LEAD in their food!
customer_reviews.text: Blue Buffalo has a lawsuite out against them for EXCESIVE LEAD LEVELS in their Dog Food.... I will NEVER AGAIN use this product. They are killing their customers!!
customer_reviews.author: ScottieM

customer_reviews.title: They are not chicken and poultry free!
customer_reviews.text: To be truthful they seem like nice biscuits however the description on the page that says they are "chicken meal and poultry free" is incorrect. the second ingredient on the bag is chicken meal the fourth is chicken fat. I had to return them because my dog is allergic to chicken.
customer_reviews.author: Di

customer_reviews.title: Made My Lab Sick
customer_reviews.text: Every time I gave this to my lab, she threw up. She really did enjoy them and my other dog was fine with them, so I didn't give it 1 star across the board. She does fine with Pup Peroni and Milk Bone treats, but something in these Blue Buffalo Wilderness Trail Treats upset her stomach. We tried 4 or 5 times across long periods with these to see if it could have been something else making her sick, but it was definitely these.
customer_reviews.author: HuntingGeek

customer_reviews.title: Very Crumbly
customer_reviews.text: These are dry biscuits approximately 1" square, 1/4" thick, see photo. All 3 of my dogs like them, but they are extremely crumbly, you can't snap them neatly in half for a smaller dog, or to give as training tidbits, you will get a handful of crumbs. The bottom of the bag has a lot of crumbs and dust, too. My dogs will still eat it if I pour the crumbs into their dish but you can't drop a few into your pocket or training pouch as you will end up with nothing but powder. I'll give 4 stars for the high quality ingredients and dogs like them, but they are just too messy and fragile to get 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca LTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: FDA warning about Blue Buffalo
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately, this product has been put on a list warning customers of related heart disease. The FDA released this warning but I don't see any reaction from Amazon about stopping orders on these dog and cat products.
customer_reviews.author: Rick R

customer_reviews.title: Darva Approved!
customer_reviews.text: I currently have two types of treats/snacks that I give to her. The Blue Buffalo treats and some milk bones that my parents gave to me. Using her excitement level as a scale when she knows it's the container that has the Blue Buffalo biscuits vs the milk bones, she prefers the biscuits. Granted, this is judging a dog who will also happily eat cat poop. So take that excitement scale with a grain of salt Her dad prefers Blue Buffalo products over many others because they provide a more natural and healthier alternative for snacks.
customer_reviews.author: David B

customer_reviews.title: Happy Grain-Free Pups!
customer_reviews.text: My dogs love these treats! I love that they are grain-free, as grains are not a part of an appropriate diet for a dog. I also LOVE the price they have on them right now. Lowest price on grain-free treats, so I ordered 8 bags! The only complaint that I have is when I try to break them in half, they crumble a little, but I can't complain too much because I know it's because they don't include any grain flour to hold them together.
customer_reviews.author: Alexandria AndrewsTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: The turkey flavor... is just ok
customer_reviews.text: My dogs eat the milk bone dog treats readily but I wanted to find something better for them; however, they need to eat them to be worth it. So, my dogs don’t love these wilderness treats but don’t hate them either. That is why I gave it 3 stars. Sometimes, my dogs will walk away from the biscuit or they might take it and drop it. Then they might eat it. I have one dog that likes them more than my other dog but overall they could take this biscuit or leave it. I bought the turkey flavor so I might try a different flavor.
customer_reviews.author: Rita C

customer_reviews.title: second ingredient is chicken meal!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my dog as we are doing an allergy elimination diet for her with salmon only food/treats, and the description on amazon and the front of the bag itself says there's no meal or by products in it, but when I received the treats, the second ingredient is chicken meal! So these are now useless as we can't feed them to our dog. This is false advertising. I want my money back.
customer_reviews.author: Ky

customer_reviews.title: Low Glycemic Dog Treats
customer_reviews.text: Our dog loves these duck-based treats! They smell very liver-y, but he thinks they are great! We can't give any of the treats we used to, because our dog developed diabetes. Yet he still expects an after-potty treat in morning and evening. I searched for "low glycemic dog treats" and found these. We time giving a treat closely with his insulin shot. He's smallish (a Corgi), so half of one of these (about 20 calories, mostly protein/fat) is sufficient. Glad to be able to "treat" him without hurting him by sending his blood sugar soaring.
customer_reviews.author: A student of history

customer_reviews.title: Our Dog Doesn't Like These Treats
customer_reviews.text: My dog, a 9 mo old, 50 lb Lab mix absolutely loves the Blue Buffalo Wilderness Trail Treats, but these... not so much. They're about the size of a silver dollar and as thick as a paperback book. The first one I gave to her she carried away and left it on the carpet without eating. I gave the same one to her again and she did chew it up, but it quickly turns to dust (extremely dry) and makes a mess. She doesn't hate them, but she doesn't prefer them.
customer_reviews.author: JohnnyPTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: AS A WARNING FOR SUBSCRIBE AND SAVE
customer_reviews.text: First off, my dog loves these treats. We use these large dry treats when she is getting a special treat, and the small soft training treats for training. However, if you order this as part of the subscribe and save be prepared to be disappointed. Because all of our items come in one large box these treats ended up being crushed. A third of the bag was powder or marble size pieces, I'd estimate that of the rest more then half was broken. All told less then a third of the bag was whole treats, my advice would be to buy at the store not amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not sure
customer_reviews.text: I'm sure this product is fine, but none of my three picky dogs would eat these. It's hard for me to comment on the flavor other than to say my dogs are really picky eaters. The biscuits were of good size, were still whole and not broken even after delivery. They were crunchy seemed to be a great treat idea, but my lucky eaters had nothing to do with them. My boyfriend gives them away to dogs he meets while he does his deliveries, he tells me that other dogs seem to like them.
customer_reviews.author: Annette  Beane

customer_reviews.title: Great crunchy biscuit!
customer_reviews.text: My dog loves these. They are crunchy little biscuits but not hard to chew. That’s exactly what I wanted. They definitely smell like fish. I bought the salmon. I like that I can read the ingredients and it doesn’t sound like a chemistry problem. My dog stays outside. When I give him a biscuit he tries to eat it quickly in hopes I’ll stay. It’s like trying to eat crackers quickly. Lol It’s definitely not a problem. I make him slow down. I think they are a great treat. I’m pretty particular.
customer_reviews.author: Cowboy’s wife

customer_reviews.title: I thought I wasted my money but I decided to give it a ...
customer_reviews.text: Originally thought I was buying the duck soft cubes I usually buy in pet store. Bought 5 bags for my Shitzu because the price was unbelievable. When it came, at first I thought oh s#%^. Cause it was biscuits and too big for him since he has half his teeth at this late stage. I thought I wasted my money but I decided to give it a try and started breaking them up for him. Much to my surprise he loves them just as much as the cubes. He goes wild when I grab the bag
customer_reviews.author: Raymond G. Mazzone

customer_reviews.title: Healthy and affordable
customer_reviews.text: My Rottweiler loves these!!! I made a commitment to be diligent in giving my dogs healthy food and treats. Amazon has been great for that with the wide variety product reviews and subscribe and save. I buy all of my dogs food and treats for the month using subscribe and save, so convenient to have it all delivered to my door each month!!! These are one of her favorites, she would eat the whole bag in one sitting if I let her. With subscribe & save they run about $4 a bag, can't beat that for a truly healthy treat.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy K

customer_reviews.title: Great treats at a great price
customer_reviews.text: Great price for my dogs' favorite baked treat. I've been buying the various flavors of these treats in smaller bags for a long time, but they go through them quickly. Not only are these grain free, but they also don't have any sugar, which I've spotted in the ingredients lists of so many "healthy" treats, in the form of honey, molasses or maple syrup. I give my dogs one of these right before bedtime, so being sugar free is particularly important to me.
customer_reviews.author: Debbie

customer_reviews.title: My Dogs LOVE These Denali Biscuits!
customer_reviews.text: I have two fairly picky eaters and they like crunchy things. They love cookies and I have had difficulty in finding a good cookie that I can easily break in half or crumble into their food (*should I need to do that). These Denali cookies are really lovely. They don't smell bad and they hold up in the "cooky jar" that I have in a drawer for my pups! They are a big favorite in my house. The first bag I ordered was gone in about a week!
customer_reviews.author: Stevie Wilson

customer_reviews.title: This will be our new tree, our finicky eater loves them !
customer_reviews.text: My picky eater loves these... I wish they came in a small dog size... Even though he thinks he’s a Bull Mastif, he is a rescue mutt believed to be a Pug and Maltese mixture... I try to break them into thirds but they crumble... I don’t mind it though because at the end I take all of the crumble pieces, Crush them and sprinkle them over the food that is good for him that he doesn’t like the taste of so nothing goes to waste.
customer_reviews.author: Erin B

customer_reviews.title: Good for some dogs
customer_reviews.text: My dogs loved them-ish but The hubster brought them home (atta girl - shift the blame) and didn’t notice that the biscuits have a high fat content. This is probably fine for our giant Great Dane/pit bull/Dalmatian/ retriever dog ( the largest and sweetest dog ever) but the Grand Doyenne of family , Shi Fu, is about 15 years old and has chronic pancreatitis and fat is her enemy.
customer_reviews.author: One Broken Shoelace

customer_reviews.title: Only Biscuit my Treat-Picky Girl Eats!
customer_reviews.text: My Treat-Picky Maltipoo Loooves these treats. Red Meat & Turkey are her go-tos. ONLY biscuit type treat she will eat and I’ve tried them (ok, she’s tried them all). She’s a chicken wrapped stick girl but boy does she love these biscuits. She doesn’t like Salmon & we live on a brook so I can’t look at my ducklings and feed her duck biscuits. Turkey & Red Meat are great tho. Highly Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Natalie Bezuhov

customer_reviews.title: Warning: Really Great Treats
customer_reviews.text: I use the Salmon ones for when I brush my dog. These are her favorite treats out of five different brands we've tried. If I give her just one of these she will tolerate all the things she isn't into like bathing and brushing. It takes her a while to finish one, they are fairly dense and big enough to make her chew thoroughly.m. We've tried the Denali as well and Pup definitely approves of them, too. Salmon is her favorite but the Denali smells better to me, haha. We're on bag three and won't stop reordering. Thanks for making such amazing treats!
customer_reviews.author: Will

customer_reviews.title: Formula has changed!
customer_reviews.text: My dog loved these before and I regularly ordered them. This time, they are oddly colored, don't smell like the other batches, and my dog doesn't like the taste. I still had a pack of the older ones and so was able to compare them when I saw that they were very different and my dog turned up her nose at them. Something has changed and not for the better. Very disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: Sundance

customer_reviews.title: My dog likes these
customer_reviews.text: My dog likes these biscuits. They smell fishy, so be prepared for that. I wasn't. You might not want kisses for a little bit after your dog has one. The bottom half of the bag is full of broken ones. I don't know if I'll buy them again. I haven't decided yet. She does like them and they have great ingredients. I just don't know if I'm quite won over.
customer_reviews.author: Cindi Clinton

customer_reviews.title: Great biscuits
customer_reviews.text: My dog really likes them. I'd give 5 star, but I'm gonna remove one for - and that's gonna sound silly - the packaging. I've gone through 5 or 6 of these bags, and no matter how careful I am when opening them, the plastic zip thingy that allows you to close the bag always ends up tearing away from the sides of the bag. This hasn't happened with any of my other treats, which use a wider zip.
customer_reviews.author: Gallani Guillaume

customer_reviews.title: Misleading advertisement .
customer_reviews.text: I got these treats because of my dog on a strict diet( no chicken, beef, corn, wheat, ext). After giving her 1 treat I start reading ingredients more carefully just for info. surprise surprise... Chicken fat, chicken meal... Really? What happens to "no chicken, real turkey"? I spent over $700 on the vet visits for just the last 2 months. I will never buy this brand ever again! Sending this open bag back today.
customer_reviews.author: Igor Rudzko

customer_reviews.title: Makes Big Dogs Choke
customer_reviews.text: The Biscuits are so dry and crumbly that they cause some dogs to choke. I first noticed my lab who loves her treats coughing and trying to clear her throat immediately after eating the first one. My smaller dog who chews things more thoroughly before swallowing did not have this problem, but when I gave one to another large mix-breed dog, it had the same choking response. I'm guessing that the dry powdery consistency irritates their throats and will not risk turning them off on treats by trying it again. The "Use By" date on the package is April 16 2017 which was six months away at the time of this experience.
customer_reviews.author: WilliWu

customer_reviews.title: My Pibble goes bonkers for these!
customer_reviews.text: Their main ingredient is salmon. They smell like salmon. They have a nice crunch and texture. Most importantly, my doggo goes bonkers for these things. More so than any other treat I've found. A bit expensive compared to grocery store brands but the ingredients are quality and not filler. I feel more comfortable giving her these.
customer_reviews.author: drose

customer_reviews.title: Rats.
customer_reviews.text: It's my fault for expecting SALMON treats to be salmon and not chicken fat. If I'd wanted chicken fat treats, I'd have saved $9 and gone to the dollar store.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Will keep buying!
customer_reviews.text: I've been trying to transition my Doberman to an all grain free diet but what dog doesn't love dog biscuits? So, I tried these out and she loves them so much that she knows when I go to get the bag she is getting one. I immediately turned around and bought more. She is a Doberman so not a small dog, so I do feel like I go through them faster. It would be nice if they were available in a bigger dog biscuit size.
customer_reviews.author: B. Owen

customer_reviews.title: Great value and our small dog likes these!
customer_reviews.text: Bag is resealable, a real plus, although it is possible to tear the resealable feature from the bag, so be careful when re-opening. Our small dog (Chihuahua/Schipperke mix, about 15 lbs) likes these treats, although they're almost at the too large size for him. Sometimes we break them in half for him. Great value, compared to in store pricing.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: My dogs love them, and will continue to buy them often
customer_reviews.text: Buy these very often . My dogs love them, and will continue to buy them often. When the price drops is the best time, as there are other places to get them, but to save time and Amazons great service prefer to get them at Amazon as can get regularly with no hassles. My dogs can't wait for their packages. Many complaints about sick problems. perhaps your dogs have allergies. As I know of many folks that are extremely happy with this product. Sharon
customer_reviews.author: SharonYoungleson M.D.,P.C.

customer_reviews.title: Crunchy Dog Treat Goodness!
customer_reviews.text: These crunchy dog treats are awesome and haven't met a dog who doesn't love them. Plus these treats are value priced for the high quality Blue Buffalo brand, and are much cheaper here on Amazon than you can find in your local pet store. Please note that the Salmon flavor treats do indeed have a fish odor...I expected that and it doesn't bother me but felt I should mention it, in case someone may have a sensitivity to that smell.
customer_reviews.author: LmShaw

customer_reviews.title: Was a fan - not anymore - too many recalls - dog got sick
customer_reviews.text: Stopped giving to our dog after she had a serious intestinal reaction. We had been giving her these for several years without a problem but then she had a reaction and I read about numerous issues with these including recalls. Literally once we stopped giving her these she rebounded within a week. Granted the emergency vet visit cost a lot but I'll make up for it by never buying this product again for our dog.
customer_reviews.author: Safety Conscious Parent

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: What can I say except my dog loves them. He gets one or two every morning after I let him out to pee. I like them because they're not real hard or crumbly. I gave a 5 star for flavor because my dog said they were very good.
customer_reviews.author: cor999

customer_reviews.title: won't return, but won't reorder either
customer_reviews.text: The description says quality natural ingredients, but these contain potato, which is blamed for poisoning dogs who eat grain free food. Also, the pieces are very large for my small dog and difficult to break into smaller pieces. He is not crazy about the small/taste either. Will not buy again.
customer_reviews.author: D Malbec

customer_reviews.title: Good grain free dog biscuits!
customer_reviews.text: My 50 lb australian shepherd border collie puppy really loves these. The salmon one is always the cheapest of the varieties and he seems to like them all equally so we only buy this one. Way too expensive at Petsmart. I definitely would recommend this kind of grain free treat/dog biscuit. He treats them as if they are higher value than a lot of his other treats. They aren't for really small dogs though unless you want to break them up which might get messy.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren88

customer_reviews.title: Unhappy Working Line GSD
customer_reviews.text: Usually a big fan, but these are crumbling and covered in crumbs. They don’t look fresh. They look beat up and damaged by heat. The irritating part is that they cannot be returned or replaced. I have purchased these 11 times. I thought they would stand behind their product. Disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: JDK

customer_reviews.title: Our dog loves these!
customer_reviews.text: We have a Shepard/Husky mix, and he will generally eat cookie type snacks, but is picky about it. However, when we got these, he changed his tune. Every time I gave him a couple of these - right to the end of the bag (it's good size, so about two months), he devoured them within a few seconds.
customer_reviews.author: tommytrekr

customer_reviews.title: My Lab loves these
customer_reviews.text: My Lab is older, sometimes doesn't want to eat, and will even turn away from most treats when I present them. When that happens, this is the only thing that he will eat, otherwise he won't eat at all. There is something in these that really appeals to him, and I'm glad it does.
customer_reviews.author: MaestroSteve

customer_reviews.title: and I love the fact that they are healthier than many of ...
customer_reviews.text: I have been buying these treats for my Wheaten Terrier for years now. She loves them, and I love the fact that they are healthier than many of the other brands on the shelf. I try to limit the amount of grain in my dog's diet though she is not overly sensitive to grain. My dog loves all the flavors, but I buy the salmon more than the others because her regular dog food contains more chicken and I like to give her a variety of proteins.
customer_reviews.author: J B

customer_reviews.title: Yummy, Grain Free Treats
customer_reviews.text: My dog LOVES these, and they are grain free. They don't upset her stomach and they are smelly enough to grab her attention for training. They are large square treats and can easily be broken in half for my medium sized dog. The price is UNBEATABLE and i will be purchasing these on a regular basis.
customer_reviews.author: AllSmiles123

customer_reviews.title: high value treats
customer_reviews.text: The dog loves these (beef flavor). She loves them so much she can get overly excited about them sometimes. That only happens with a few other high value treats. She's 1 and very well trained and obedient, but I still use intermittent rewards with her. If we're at the dog park for an hour I'll dole out 3-5 little bite sizes pieces. Usually for recall but not always. Works great and I feel good about the ingredient list. Also, they were super cheap!
customer_reviews.author: Dimples

customer_reviews.title: A Gag Isn't Always a Funny Thing to hear.
customer_reviews.text: Gave two stars because we use Blue Buffalo dog food and it's always been good. Not sure if something was wrong or these are just made this way: they are very crumbly. Every time my Lab had one, he gagged and gagged until what we guess was after all the crumbs were dislodged. They smelled good and he liked them, but the gag-fest that followed made them a no go.
customer_reviews.author: The Truth 101

customer_reviews.title: Grain-Free Dog Treat
customer_reviews.text: We're all big fans of Blue Buffalo's grain-free line of products, especially our basset. We moved to a grain-free diet for Jeff the basset when he began having problems with allergic itching and chewing. Switching to grain-free food is straightforward, but finding treats can be tricky. So we were very happy to try these dog biscuits. The crunchy biscuits are enthusiastically eaten by Jeff, so they must taste good (to a dog). They are largely odor free as well. This is a great treat for your four legged friend.
customer_reviews.author: S. H. Wells

customer_reviews.title: Does a dog right!
customer_reviews.text: I must admit to feeding Blue to both dogs. Look, not only are we feeding our dogs an awesome food, we also provide our dogs with the same positive levels of ingredients in treats! Their good for them, and they love the taste!? C'mon folks! What are you waiting for?
customer_reviews.author: dannyd

customer_reviews.title: Great cookie watch pricing
customer_reviews.text: usually can get them for around $4-$5 for large bag - just have to watch pricing according to my pooch Annabelle and her friends Leo &Piper, these are awesome tasting cookies.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Totally insane!
customer_reviews.text: This product is incredible. My dog goes absolutely insane when we come back from our afternoon walk. She knows she's getting this treat. She dances in circles, hops up and down, rolls over, plays dead, shakes hands and goes through her whole repertoire of tricks because she knows she's getting ready to get this treat. And she does them all in a row, without asking! It is hilarious to watch. I have to calm her down before I allow her to have the treat, and still she acts crazy all over again the next day. I an definitely a fan.
customer_reviews.author: Kneecap

customer_reviews.title: Made my dog sick!
customer_reviews.text: I have fed my dog this brand of treats for years. However, the first day I fed these to my dog, he vomited several hours later. Day 2, after eating them he vomited and had mild diarrhea. On the 3rd day, he continued to vomit after eating them and had explosive diarrhea. 24 hours after I stopped feeding him these he was fine.
customer_reviews.author: Copper Girl

customer_reviews.title: good price, and my dogs love these
customer_reviews.text: Hard to say much. I have purchased Blue Buffalo products for years and found that my dogs love their biscuits. My worries are always that my dogs will feel these are treats and that they won't get sick from eating them. These treats met that standard at a good price.
customer_reviews.author: Mvargus

customer_reviews.title: They are natural and safe for my fur baby!
customer_reviews.text: Baxter loves these, and HE is the one eating them, I assume they must be wonderful since he dances, jumps, and barks his head off if he thinks there is a remote chance he will get one. He is a small-ish dog, one is PLENTY for him! I have been concerned about what he eats, and this is a brand I trust, with quality ingredients!
customer_reviews.author: Tikha

customer_reviews.title: My pup loves this as best behavior reward.
customer_reviews.text: Great price great product my pup just loves these treats I’ve used it for during training and this product alone helped increase my dogs training time using it as a reward. I’ve never bought and cheap food for my dog this product is helped reinsure good behavior for the flavor and freshness
customer_reviews.author: Yo101jimmy

customer_reviews.title: Buy a Lot of These!
customer_reviews.text: I go through 2-3 bags of these a week with our Lab. The are calorie contolled so our dog doesn’t fatten up. But she’ll do anything to get a handout. Sometimes she drags me over to the cabinet and begs for them. Their Blue, so you know their good for dogs.
customer_reviews.author: K. Coan

customer_reviews.title: Great Grain Free Treats
customer_reviews.text: Our Yellow Lab loves these treats. He is grain free, so it is difficult to find compliant treats. These are a little larger than the peanut butter ones I found, and therefore I am able to only use 1 treat instead of 3-4 of the smaller ones. I will continue to buy these because they are his preferred "cookie".
customer_reviews.author: Renee B. Correll

customer_reviews.title: My two dogs HATE these Treats & Won't eat them!!
customer_reviews.text: My two dogs eat & Love BLUE dog food but absolutely HATE these treats! Update: I just looked at the pics from other people who took pics of the treats and the treats I received look horrible compared to the pics on here. Mine are gritty, worn & old looking.
customer_reviews.author: MeMe

customer_reviews.title: my picky dog loves these
customer_reviews.text: My dog is small and very picky with food & treats, i couldn't tell you How many different products I've tried. But my Preston, He Absolutely Loves These. I've been buying them for a while now online, they had stopped selling them at pet store I used to buy them at; Plus they are cheaper online than in the store.
customer_reviews.author: Jenna

customer_reviews.title: If your dogs need to lose a pound or two, incorporate these treats into their routine
customer_reviews.text: My dogs have lost weight on a grain free diet and appear happier with their food and more playful. Blue Buffalo treats have played a great part in the weight reduction program and they satisfy the girls. Instead of begging for treat after treat, they relish one of the Blue Buffalo treats and are completely satisfied and ready to play.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Stink like hell, but dog goes crazy for them.
customer_reviews.text: If you have a food motivated dog and you need "high value treats," these are the way to go. They smell strongly though, the entire kitchen stinks like fish when I open them, so if that is something that would bother, probably not the way to go. My dog would do ANYTHING for these treats though, so the smell is worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Olga

customer_reviews.title: Great taste
customer_reviews.text: Our Bernese Mt dog loves these treats! She is very selective with treats and these are ideal because they are easy to break in half. She is on a weight control diet and these are perfect. We will definitely order again !
customer_reviews.author: Robert Norris

customer_reviews.title: Very good quality biscuits for hongruh doggos.
customer_reviews.text: I regularly buy these for my dog unit. They have a 30% protein content (almost unheard of for biscuits). Very good quality. I hope they start producing the other flavors in the bigger bags.
customer_reviews.author: SEth A.

customer_reviews.title: My Doges Love These
customer_reviews.text: I have never tried these for the dogs before. When I opened the bag, one of them about knocked me over, and the other one stood at my feet and barked incessantly. All I had to do was give them each one, and they scarfed them down in no time. The Dogs love them, and they are very healthy for them as well. I will definitely repurchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Teddy Westside

customer_reviews.title: Quality issue
customer_reviews.text: I have had these on subscribe and save for a few years now and never had an issue. The last package I received had biscuits that were a lighter color, very crumbly and actually had what looked like small threads in them.
customer_reviews.author: JJs Mom

customer_reviews.title: Our dog loves these!
customer_reviews.text: Our dog loves these. She’s a small dog, around 25 lbs, and these treats are a little bigger so we break them in half for her. My only complaint is the bag. This is the second time we’ve gotten them and the sealing mechanism on the bag has ripped both times so we end up having to keep in a gallon ziploc bag.
customer_reviews.author: B. Walker

customer_reviews.title: Nitro loves them!
customer_reviews.text: I tried these limited ingredient grain-free biscuits for my senior when Amazon stopped selling the ones I used to buy. My Daschund likes these treats much better. These biscuits also seem much fresher and are not as hard to break for my dog
customer_reviews.author: radtechvicki

customer_reviews.title: but these definitely are his favorite! I would recommend any of their treat product ...
customer_reviews.text: My 5 month old Goldendoodle loves all of these treat products from BLUE Wilderness, but especially these Bison Biscuits. They don't have a strong smell and seem far healthier than most dog treats out there. They fit snuggly into most KONG products, and he will be quiet and trying to remove the tasty treat for a VERY long time. I work at home, so quiet time where he is silent and not in to trouble is critical (especially during conference calls). He doesn't spend large amounts of time/effort on any other treat, but these definitely are his favorite! I would recommend any of their treat product line.
customer_reviews.author: Sonia

customer_reviews.title: Beloved by our grandpup
customer_reviews.text: We periodically send a treats gift to our son's dog and this one is the most highly valued. Truman (dog) loves it and it agrees with his sensitive gut. His human owner loves it because the ingredients are clean.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon S.

customer_reviews.title: A real hit withh my dog
customer_reviews.text: Loved watching his nose and mouth response to these as in...oh this is different and then WOW...this is great as he starteed chewing. They fit nicely with my limited treat program (no more than one a day).
customer_reviews.author: Lee H.

customer_reviews.title: My GSD's love these treats!
customer_reviews.text: My GSD'S loves these baked treats. Also, grain free. Researched the content and nothing listed was amiss. Several years Past Blue Buffalo had used a product in their dry kibble that killed dogs. The China Materal was tainted with pesticide. Check for yourself, Dog Food Advisor . Com.
customer_reviews.author: Michael M.

customer_reviews.title: Just seems like a lot of treat
customer_reviews.text: Treats are HUGE! I break them in half and sometimes even break the halves in half. Just seems like a lot of treat. The good part is that these treats are not hard whatsoever, they are quite crumbly. This makes it easier to control the portions. The product seemed fresh and good quality. Though my dog did not seem to enjoy the flavor of these too much, they are still a product that I would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: G L

customer_reviews.title: Not for all dogs
customer_reviews.text: I vend at many outdoor events where dogs are prevalent. I always try to have dog treats in my booth to give them. I tried this product and I have to say more dogs turned up their noses at it than enjoyed it. I think I have only encountered 2 of 10 dogs so far that would eat it. Probably won't buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Deidra Toney

customer_reviews.title: Good value and healthy
customer_reviews.text: Got these on sale and their great! Kind of larger treats so I broke them up smaller to go further. They are pretty rich and made my dogs stool a bit soft and running. Used in moderation
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Rohrer

customer_reviews.title: Delicious, loved treat for dogs!
customer_reviews.text: My dog LOVES these treats! (ok he is kinda a treat addict, but these are his favorite!) They are great for training. They are just the right size for when he wants "desert". I buy they every month!
customer_reviews.author: BoatMom

customer_reviews.title: Dog Approved
customer_reviews.text: These are little square dry cookies. Normally my dogs prefer jerky treats, but they actually really like these.
customer_reviews.author: R. Bonneau

customer_reviews.title: Blue Buffalo delivers again
customer_reviews.text: My puppy loves these! I have a toy breed (Morkie), so the size of these treats are an issue. They're not hard to break apart and I'm sure Blue Buffalo probably offers smaller treats. The quality of this product is second to none, as is the case with all Blue Buffalo products. These treats don't have any of your typical fillers as ingredients, everything is designed in the best interest of our K9 friends. I'd highly recommend Blue Buffalo treats, along with their food which is also top quality.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle P

customer_reviews.title: Will your dog eat this?
customer_reviews.text: I bought two bags of this hoping to use as a treat for my Eski, but she who eats everything wouldn't touch it. My neighbor has two dogs so I gave the two sacks to him. This product maybe great, but my dog doesn't think so.
customer_reviews.author: COCO RODENT

customer_reviews.title: Lab loves these treats, great texture and no fillers.
customer_reviews.text: My Labrador retriever simply loves these Blue Wilderness Trail Treats. So far I've tried the Salmon and the Turkey flavors and he seems really excited to eat them. These biscuits are more crumbly and better textured than many other biscuits that seem to have a lot more fillers and grain. They are also larger about an 1.5 inch square, I usually give my lab 2 at a time, and he just gobbles them up super fast.
customer_reviews.author: Zen

customer_reviews.title: Good buy
customer_reviews.text: The ingredients seem to be healthy but my dog can take them or leave them. He's pretty picky though. They came in perfect condition & different flavors, I'll attempt another flavor once he finishes this bag.
customer_reviews.author: DS

customer_reviews.title: SAFE treats pet owners can trust and loved by dogs
customer_reviews.text: My 2 dogs love these treats. I only feed my dogs grain free food & treats. With all of the FDA recalls right now it is comforting to know that my dogs are safe with Blue Buffalo. You can see after the recalls that Blue Buffalo has seen a huge increase in sales. The trail treats have been selling out quickly. The whole trail treats line is popular among owners & pets. Just an fyi....I feed my 2 dogs Rachael Ray Zero Grain salmon dog food & Blue Buffalo salmon trail treats.
customer_reviews.author: TXSHOPPER

customer_reviews.title: Product description is a lie
customer_reviews.text: Product description says, "Wilderness dog treats are grain free and contain no chicken (or poultry) by-product meals" What the ingredients say on the package: "...Chicken Meal...Chicken Fat.." I bought this because my dog is on a strict diet that requires novel protein. If anyone can recommend a dog treat that fits this bill, please comment!
customer_reviews.author: Carla Howell

customer_reviews.title: Crumbs and a Biscuit
customer_reviews.text: Ridiculous! I ordered a total of 7 bags of 3 different flavor biscuits. All arrived intact except for the Denali biscuits. They were bags of mostly crumbs. There were maybe 9 or 10 Almost whole biscuits between the two bags. They appeared to have been run over by a truck.
customer_reviews.author: Skott

customer_reviews.title: really good
customer_reviews.text: my girl loves it, can't wait until I put it in her dish, seems to help give her energy and her coat (which is as thick as lambs wool) does very little shedding, if you own a Husky you might just be in for a pleasant surprise, especially if you have one that sheds a lot
customer_reviews.author: Ralph Paulsen

customer_reviews.title: Favorite treats
customer_reviews.text: Our lab mastiff recently developed a grain allergy and this is the first crunchy biscuit type treat she has ever liked, usually prefers chewy type treats. We started with 1 bag a month but have gone up to two on auto ship every month we use them so much.
customer_reviews.author: melissa

customer_reviews.title: Dog loves them!!
customer_reviews.text: These are great treats!! Our little puppy LOVES them!! They smell like salmon!! Which is a good thing because that means you know it’s real! We don’t typically buy anything from this brand as thier kibble isn’t the best for your pup. However, we have researched this and the ingredients are great and our puppy really likes them!! Great treat!! They are pretty big but break apart fairly easily if needed for smaller treats!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazonbuyer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent treat according to our dog.
customer_reviews.text: Our dog likes them. She is kind of choosy regarding treats. These are as good as peanut butter or a cold carrot as far as she is concerned. As to flavor, couldn't comment, haven't tried the myself.
customer_reviews.author: Kokopelli

customer_reviews.title: Dangerous recall, making animals sick!
customer_reviews.text: Blue buffalo treats and food are on recall and you shouldn’t be selling them I have throwing out all the treats and food I’ve ordered from you! Don’t understand how they are still distributing them to you or that you are still selling the product, my little dog is sick and some dogs have died 😢I feel you did not know or you would have stopped sales please look into this!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Quality product.
customer_reviews.text: My dog wasn’t that fond of these but ate them slowly along. It took a while to get her to eat them rather than maybe eat one or leave it for a while. The treats that she really loves she will eat all at once. Thank you though. Fast shipping with quality.
customer_reviews.author: K&P Jodi

customer_reviews.title: Habit Forming!
customer_reviews.text: My dog is hooked on that particular treat. Picky? Offer him a milk bone and turns away. Once given to your four-legged family member, you can forget buying anything that has little or no flavor.
customer_reviews.author: Donald Willinger

customer_reviews.title: Yummy Treats
customer_reviews.text: Another winner in tastier treats for dogs by Blue Wilderness. Unfortunately, supplies of. These yummy turkey treats are frequently scooped up quickly. Would highly recommend them for your dog.
customer_reviews.author: GinGin

customer_reviews.title: Blue Buffalo Treats are the best...dogs love them!
customer_reviews.text: These little treats are a favorite of my dogs...they get one in the evening and they are so excited when they see the package. Blue Buffalo makes great dog and cat food, too!
customer_reviews.author: Old Doc

customer_reviews.title: EXCELLENT PRICE! My dog LOVES them!
customer_reviews.text: The price can’t be beat!! A bag that is essentially have the size of this one is $9 in my local store. There is plenty of treats in the bag, and they aren’t too small or chinsy. They’re relatively thick. My dog seems very happy with my purchase and I got a great deal - so it’s a win/win!
customer_reviews.author: Melanie D.

customer_reviews.title: Healthy grain free
customer_reviews.text: I only buy these grain free biscuits for my golden doodle Easy to chew as she is older dog I order constantly
customer_reviews.author: Diana Wallach

customer_reviews.title: Treats are too large and they can't be broken in half because they crumble.
customer_reviews.text: These are very large treats for a small to a medium size dog (Beagle). They may be fine for a large dog such as a German Shepherd. I wish they were made in a smaller size.
customer_reviews.author: AL G

customer_reviews.title: Very happy
customer_reviews.text: I have these on auto for my Daughters dog every month he receives them and he loves them. And he knows they are from nana they always take a picture so I know they were delivered. .
customer_reviews.author: Dawn French

customer_reviews.title: My Chow Chows LOVE these!
customer_reviews.text: My two Chow Chows absolutely love these Blue Buffalo Wilderness Trail Treats Grain-Free Salmon Biscuits. The place I buy them locally is often out of the salmon biscuits so it seems that most dogs like them as much as my two do. I have tried giving them the Blue Buffalo Wilderness Trail Treats Grain-Free Turkey Biscuits (and other "flavors") when I can't get the salmon ones but they don't like those much and will only eat them if there is nothing else. Only problem I have had with these is if I order them they are not always packed well and get crushed, but that is NOT Blue Buffalo's fault.
customer_reviews.author: DeWitch

customer_reviews.title: Great ingredients and dogs love them
customer_reviews.text: My dogs love these.. good ingredients list, not full of garbage like the cheap pet treats. I think these are reasonable prices for how well made they are, and my dogs love them..
customer_reviews.author: Al

customer_reviews.title: but they love these! I either purchase the Denali biscuits or ...
customer_reviews.text: My dogs can be rather finicky with their treats and snacks, but they love these! I either purchase the Denali biscuits or the Salmon biscuits: so far, my dogs haven ever get sick or ill from these treats. My canines happily look forward to their getting treats at bedtime with their vitamins!!
customer_reviews.author: Nicole Danielle Yorgensen

customer_reviews.title: I like that they aren't too hard and I'm glad they ...
customer_reviews.text: They smell fishy. Luckily it doesn't leave a lingering smell because my dog's breath is smelly enough sometimes. Anyway, dog loves these, they arrived fresh and crunchy. I like that they aren't too hard and I'm glad they don't leave a crumbly mess all over my floor when eaten. They're decently sized and I think the price is fair for a decent doggie treat.
customer_reviews.author: RiTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: BLUE Wilderness Grain Free Biscuits Crunchy Dog Treats
customer_reviews.text: My dogs really look forward to their treats. We trust this product and also use the Blue Buffalo Bison Adult Dog Food. I especially like their poop. Sounds strange? It is nice to pickup dog poop which is solid and you can see my healthy dogs outside playing. We always receive comments on how well our dogs look and act, it must be their food!
customer_reviews.author: Richard S. Greer

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: Got these for Christmas for my 14lb dog. HVent opened them yet but they do feel like they break apart easy. Hopefully my dog likes them, she isn’t that picky.
customer_reviews.author: Emilee Ward

customer_reviews.title: Okay, I did not taste these, but my puppy LOVES them!
customer_reviews.text: I can offer two different treats and he will choose this one every time. Of course, it is Blue so the quality is premium. Great bargain for this sized bag.
customer_reviews.author: John E. Litton

product_meta.title: Blue Buffalo Wilderness Trail Treats Grain Free Biscuits Crunchy Dog Treats
product_meta.description: Flavor Name:Turkey| Size:24 ozBlue Buffalo wilderness trail treats high protein grain free crunchy Dog Treats Biscuits, turkey recipe 24-oz bag
feature_bullets: PACKED WITH REAL TURKEY: BLUE Wilderness Trail Treats start with real turkey as the first ingredient, making them a truly irresistible dog treat.
CRUNCHY DOG TREATS: These dog biscuits are made with an irresistible crunch to satisfy their wild side and help clean teeth.
WHOLESOME INGREDIENTS: Made with omega 3 & 6 fatty acids plus antioxidants, these grain free dog treats are more than just tasty, they’re healthy too!
NATURAL DOG TREATS: Featuring only wholesome ingredients you’ll love feeding, Wilderness dog treats are grain free and contain no chicken (or poultry) by-product meals, and no corn, wheat or soy.
Contains (1) 24oz bag of Blue Buffalo Wilderness Trail Treats High Protein Grain Free Crunchy Dog Treats Biscuits, Turkey Recipe

Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
